channel.title: CVE Feed for c-ares -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for c-ares -- all

item.title: CVE-2024-25629|2024-02-23T14:52:24.967Z -- c-ares -- c-ares
item.description: c-ares is a C library for asynchronous DNS requests. `ares__read_line()` is used to parse local configuration files such as `/etc/resolv.conf`, `/etc/nsswitch.conf`, the `HOSTALIASES` file, and if using a c-ares version prior to 1.27.0, the `/etc/hosts` file. If any of these configuration files has an embedded `NULL` character as the first character in a new line, it can lead to attempting to read memory prior to the start of the given buffer which may result in a crash. This issue is fixed in c-ares 1.27.0. No known workarounds exist.
